description: The ability to reproduce is one of the key features of a living organism. Studying the biology of reproduction requires a synthesis of information and concepts from a wide range of fields within biology. This course addresses reproduction at the genetic, organismal, and population levels. Laboratory work adds a valuable investigative component to the course, and social/psychological issues are addresssed throughout. Counts as "comparative organismal biology" core category. Counts toward women's and gender studies major and concentration if approved by petition. Prerequisites: BIO 150 or permission of instructor.
name: Biology of Reproduction
notes: Students in BIO 275 must also register for BIO 275 lab. This course has
class year limits. Not open to first-year students.
prerequisites: Prerequisites: BIO 150 or permission of instructor.
